tz.co.rita.birthregistration

Class BirthRegistrationApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • Application
      • tz.co.rita.birthregistration.BirthRegistrationApplication

  • public class BirthRegistrationApplication
extends Application
    This is the main Application class that represents the common state of the entire application. As long as any part of the application is running, the application object will exist. It provides a number of static global functions that can be invoked from anywhere within the application to fetch application wide constants and configuration options as well as various application state values.
    Since:
    June, 2015
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Molalgne Girmaw

      • app_locked

        public static boolean app_locked
        A boolean static member that indicates whether the application has been locked (prevented from running by the system administrator.) This state can only be changed through an authorised message from the server either using SMS or Internet connectivity.
        The application can be made valid again through administrative command messages. The data will remain intact and operation would resume once the setting has been updated to valid again. This is intended to ensure that a suspect rogue application is prevented from running and creating and uploading records. The action can be reversed.

      • app_invalid

        public static boolean app_invalid
        A boolean static member that indicates whether the application has been permanently prevented from running by the system administrator. This state can only be changed through an authorised message from the server either using SMS or Internet connectivity.
        When an administrator sends the command to make this application invalid, currently existing data is wiped-out and cannot be recovered. The application must also be reinstalled before it can be used again. This state is intended to disable the application permanently and wipe any data currently stored in its internal database, in cases where the phone running the app is permanently compromised and the administrator wants to prevent it from reading, creating or in anyway accessing the application, its data or any of its features permanently.

      • getInstance

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate()
        Android life-cycle method called when the application is starting.
        Sets up the singleton instance variable, gets a handle of the sharedpreferences Updates all preference member fields by reading their current value in the preferences list and initializes the SDSMS Manager and assigns callback variable to the SDSMS managers receiver callback method.
